setting.info: PODI server address.
PODI certificate.
Encryption password entered in the Administrative Client for the web pages of Patterns and Curve.
Indicates if the site purchased Patterns.
Indicates if the site purchased Curve.
Code of the banner: 0 for PeriGen, 1 for Power by PeriGen.
Indicates if PODI sends the Epidural value or it must be entered in the UI.
Indicates if PODI sends the VBAC value or it must be entered in the UI.
Indicates if PODI sends the Previous Vaginal value or it must be entered in the UI.
Display or hide the 50% percentile curve line.
VBAC percentile limit, possible values are 3 for 3-97, 5 for 5-95 or 10 for 10-90.
VBAC number of hours with no dilation progress for dystocia.
Non VBAC percentile limit, possible values 3 for 3-97, 5 for 5-95 or 10 for 10-90.
Non VBAC number of hours with no dilation progress for dystocia.
Duration in minutes used to calculate the contractility rate.
Maximum value on the Y scale for the contractility graph.
Number of contractions in the contractility rate that triggers the stage 1 color.
Duration in minutes after which a stage 1 is upgraded to a stage 2 in the contractility rate.
Database path for saving data.
Archive database path.
URL to the WCF data service. Change it if you enabled https or change the port number.
Patterns ActiveX client
Indicates if external pluggins are used.
The value sent by the CIS for the cephalic presentation, use a | for separator if multiples values.
The mappings for the positions displayed in CIS (i.e. ROA) to the internal positions in Patterns (i.e. 6).
A visit discharged for more than xx hours is purged. That delay must stay under 7 days (168 hours).
Indicates whether patient's Patterns DB will be deleted after discharge
After how many seconds without a chalkboard refresh do we set the 'offline' status.
How often the Patterns client refreshes the data (in seconds).
If not closed by the user, all dialogs opened by the Patterns ActiveX will be closed automatically after xx minute(s).
How often the Curve client refreshes the data (in seconds).
How many days of tracing in the past can be returned to the ActiveX.
If the live tracing is more than xx seconds off from the current clock time, then mark the episode as late live.
Enable logging of tracings data sent to Patterns engine.
Exact version of the Patterns ActiveX client that is expected by the server. All requests from another version are rejected. .
Exact version of the Curve XBAP client that is expected by the server. All requests from another version are rejected. .
Minimum amount of physical memory required.
Minimum number of physical cores required.
By default, only local IP client can access the Admin IP addresses on the web service and chalkboard.
Indicates if Curve review mode can be used.
File name of the catalog database.
File name of the archive catalog database.
DB connection string format and options.
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the refresh of the chalkboard.
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the data calculation (Patterns detection, Curve calculation).
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the commit to the database of the patient data.
Minimum duration in seconds between two iterations for the compress tracings.
Minimum duration in hours between two iterations for the maintenance.
For debugging, set to true so that debugging trace includes all requests and answers from the Patterns client. This logs too much to stay on for long.
For debugging, set to true so that debugging trace includes all requests and answers from the Curve client. This logs too much to stay on for long.
Maximum duration in seconds of a block when splitting the tracings returned by PODI.
Maximum bridgeable gap for tracing when merging the small blocks before saving to database.
Maximum duration in seconds of a merged block when merging the small blocks before saving to database.
Minimum gap in the tracing (in seconds) that will trigger a recycling of the detection engine.
Maximum duration in seconds of a merged block when preparing the data before processing it in the detection engine.
Priming buffer length in minutes when restarting an engine on an episode with existing tracings (useful on server restart mostly).
Minimum duration of new tracing before triggering a patterns detection.
Maximum duration in seconds of a tracing that can be a candidate for a compression.
The most xxx recents blocks are never compressed in cache in order to permit the incremental updates from ActiveX to work properly.
Maximum gap in the tracing (in seconds) when compressing blocks stored in memory.
Timeout in seconds when stopping the service.
The maximum number of concurrent connections allowed by a ServicePoint object.
The maximum idle time, in milliseconds, of a ServicePoint object.
URL to open the Patterns client.
URL to open the Curve client.
URL of the WCF data service. Change it if you enabled https or change the port number.
